metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39686 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: In several functions of binder.c, there is a possible way to represent the wrong domain to SELinux due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-200688826References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: sbeattie> AppArmor is the default MAC LSM for Ubuntu, not SELinux, though it is possible to boot with SELinux enforcement in place.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
